description: Human-readable task description, often including service type and component being serviced. Used to communicate what work is to be performed.
Code indicating maintenance type, such as preventive versus corrective work.
Timestamp when the task was created or issued for work.
Timestamp when the task was completed and administratively closed.
Scheduled due date/time by which the task should be completed.
Identifier of the technician or employee assigned to perform the task.
Identifier of the supervisor overseeing the task.
Identifier of the crew leader responsible for field execution.
Code for the source of the request (e.g., operator report, inspection, telematics); confirm with SME.
Identifier of the original work request linked to this task.
User who approved the task or work order; confirm with SME.
Classification of the requesting customer (e.g., internal department or external client); confirm with SME.
Identifier for the requester or customer associated with the task.
Name of the requesting customer or department.
Requester’s mobile phone number for contact.
Alternate phone number for the requester.
Requester’s email address.
External portal reference or submission ID for the request; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the equipment operator who reported the issue; confirm with SME.
Reference ID for the reported issue from an incident or ticketing system; confirm with SME.
Short summary of the requester’s service need.
Additional comments provided by the requester.
Supervisor’s notes or instructions related to the task.
Code indicating urgency or service priority for scheduling and SLA management.
Detailed narrative of the service request.
Internal notes about the request, not necessarily visible to the requester.
Key linking to the service location’s address record.
Street name of the service location.
Street number of the service location.
City of the service location.
Postal code of the service location.
Textual description of the specific work location at the site.
Nearest cross street to help locate the asset or work area.
User-defined text field for client-specific data; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined text field for client-specific data; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined text field for client-specific data; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined text field for client-specific data; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined text field for client-specific data; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined text field for client-specific data; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined text field for client-specific data; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined text field for client-specific data; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined text field for client-specific data; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined text field for client-specific data; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined date field for client-specific tracking; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined date field for client-specific tracking; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined date field for client-specific tracking; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined numeric field for client-specific metrics; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined numeric field for client-specific metrics; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined numeric field for client-specific metrics; purpose varies by configuration.
Narrative of the work performed to resolve the issue.
Reference number for a template, task model, or time record; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the work request associated with this task.
Name of the shop, work group, or division responsible for the task.
Project identifier to which the task’s costs are charged.
Identifier for the internal or external customer receiving the service.
Identifier of the external vendor contracted for part or all of the work.
Accounting or activity code categorizing the type of work performed.
Management unit or cost center accountable for the work order.
Financial account number used to charge the work order.
Code for the shop or facility where the work order is processed.
Status code indicating whether the overall work order is in progress; confirm with SME.
Sequence number for the asset within a multi-asset work order.
Primary identifier of the asset (unit) being serviced.
Code representing the asset’s category or class.
Descriptive text about the asset, such as model or configuration.
Identifier for the subsystem or component within the asset; confirm with SME.
Code indicating the failure type or mode observed; confirm with SME.
Text description of the failure or problem reported.
Percentage of the task’s cost allocated to this customer, project, or department.
General remarks or additional notes about the task.
Numeric score or condition rating recorded for this task or inspection; confirm with SME.
Timestamp when work on the asset was completed for this task.
Optional field reserved for client-specific use; confirm intended meaning with SME.
Optional field reserved for client-specific use; confirm intended meaning with SME.
Task-level status flag indicating work in progress; confirm with SME.
Total asset downtime attributable to this task, in hours.
Timestamp when work on the task actually started.
Timestamp when work on the task finished.
Department or entity that owns the asset being serviced.
Code for the shop, yard, or facility handling this task.
Identifier for a sublocation, bay, or stall within a facility; confirm with SME.
Financial account number to charge this task’s costs.
Management unit or cost center accountable for this task.
Code classifying the specific maintenance activity performed.
Work order number to which this task belongs.
Alternate asset identifier used on the work order; confirm differences from asset_id with SME.
Task number within the work order.
Sequence value controlling task order within the work order.
Identifier for the task definition or template; confirm with SME.
Completion flag indicating whether the task is finished; confirm coding with SME.
Detailed description of the specific task steps or scope.
Type of result recorded for the task (e.g., pass/fail, numeric reading); confirm with SME.
Type of meter associated with the reading (e.g., hours, mileage); confirm with SME.
Recorded result or reading value captured for the task.
Reference to attachments such as photos, documents, or diagnostics.
Notes entered upon completion detailing outcomes or follow-up needs.
Calculation or rule applied to evaluate results or compliance; confirm with SME.
Flag indicating whether the task is mandatory for compliance or completion; confirm with SME.
Date/time the task was marked complete in the system.
Portion of the total work order cost assigned to this task (amount or percent); confirm format with SME.
User who created the record.
Timestamp when the record was created.
User who last updated the record.
Timestamp of the most recent update to the record.
Geospatial geometry (point/line/polygon) representing the work or asset location; confirm format with SME.
Technician who finalized and closed the task; confirm with SME.
Estimated labor hours required to complete the task.
Percent complete at the start of the reporting period or visit; confirm with SME.
Percent complete at the end of the reporting period or visit; confirm with SME.
Directional code for location context or navigation (e.g., compass direction); confirm with SME.
Identifier linking to the stored GIS geometry object.
Aggregated actual cost for the task; may mirror the sum of cost components. Confirm how it differs from total with SME.
Quantity of work actually completed, in task-specific units.
Actual labor hours posted to the task.
Actual labor cost charged to the task.
Actual equipment usage cost charged to the task.
Actual parts cost charged to the task.
Actual miscellaneous costs charged to the task.
Actual contractor or outside service cost charged to the task.
Total actual cost of the task, typically summing labor, parts, equipment, misc, and contractor.
User-defined asset attribute captured at task level; purpose varies by configuration.
User-defined asset attribute captured at task level; purpose varies by configuration.
